title: Let the Toxicity begin.
body:
So i just came out of my worst game of league since i started 4 weeks ago.

I clearly explained to the team that i have only ever played support and did not know any other roles, yet they still forced me to go mid, Which i was perfectly fine with.

10 minutes in i was 0/4 against a Lucian, Which was quite understandable because i had warned them before the game that i had no idea what to do midlane.

TL:DR i get raged at all game, called pathetic names then reported for "trolling".

I had clearly warned them before game that i was hopeless at anything other than support, so why is it my fault?

This community is the worst i have ever seen in a video game.

replies.body:
Ignore them and move on.  You gave them fair warning about your lack of experience outside of Support.

All I can suggest, is to get into some matches against bots and practice other lanes.

> [{quoted}](name=Jockulation,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=wr2xolKw,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-11T11:06:59.846+0000)
>
> All I can suggest, is to get into some matches against bots and practice other lanes.

This. As a good rule of thumb, it's always good to have *some* experience in 3 or 4 positions, with the 1 or 2 you prefer above all others being focused on more. You can easily get *some* experience by playing against intermediate bots and practising on aspects you feel you are lacking in. For example, you might feel that your last hitting as a Mid laner is lackluster so you play a "typical" mid laner and focus on that for a few games.

After you've got some experience from that, it can be good to queue in PVP with some friends or acquaintances who understand your situation (that you're relatively new and still learning) so you can get some proper experience against other players. If you don't know anyone as of yet, I'd suggest making a thread in the "Team Recruitment" section of the boards to find players who would be willing to assist.
play top lane a bit, makes you experienced with most lanes, gives you a chance to practice last hitting (almost 2 years in, i still suck at it) and if u get stuck with jg, well, ummm, gg no re

in my experience there's just as many chill people as there are toxic people, so don't let this discourage you.
If your team is flaming you and it's affecting your play, just hit esc, go to your setting and turn off chat. Doesn't stop the ping spam but it makes it a little easier to ignore their attitude
when u think the easiest option is to turn off chat all-together instead of muting them XD

If you began playing 4 weeks ago my advice would be to play bots until you can go 10 or more kills for 1 or 2 deaths consistently with several champs on intermediate.
Once you can do that with an adc, bruiser, apc and assassin you should be able to at least hold your own in most games. 
I hate playing blind pick because of the fighting over lanes, mirror matches and having no chance to choose a rune page based on your lane opp. Draft pick was so much better but it got taken away when I think they should have gotten rid of blind pick instead.
Try other lanes in co-op and custom!
Welcome to League hope you continue to have fun
